summary: This is an email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to the court, listing the attorneys, paralegal, and family/friends of Ghislaine Maxwell who plan to attend an October 21 teleconference and a November 1 in-person pretrial conference. It is a logistical planning document for Maxwell's criminal trial proceedings.

events.title: Pretrial Teleconference
events.description: A teleconference for the case US v. Maxwell, requiring dial-in numbers and a list of speaking participants.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: An in-person pretrial conference for US v. Maxwell, requiring attendee counts and vaccination statuses due to COVID-19 protocols.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in October 2021 consisted of attorneys Bobbi C. Sternheim, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeffrey Pagliuca, with paralegal Ann Lundberg.
A significant number of Maxwell's family and friends, including Ian, Kevin, Pandora, Philip, Isabel, and Christine Maxwell, planned to attend her court conferences in support.

The court, presided over by Judge Alison J. Nathan, was planning both a teleconference and an in-person conference, with specific COVID-19 protocols requiring vaccination status for the in-person event.
The document is a logistical email showing the active pretrial phase of US v. Maxwell in late 2021.
The communication highlights the court's rule for the teleconference that only one attorney may speak per issue on behalf of the defense.
